snippet: A mayoral candidate in Montclair, N.J., has questioned the spending of the deeply in-debt municipality, but critics say that cuts will ruin the community’s signature diversity.
abstract: Karen Turner, mayoral candidate in Montclair, NJ, has set off storm of debates by calling for spending cuts in the liberal but deeply in-debt municipality; Turner's campaign has raised issues reflecting the national debate on austerity and her critics warn cuts will ruin town's diversity.
lead_paragraph: A mayoral candidate in Montclair, N.J., has questioned the spending of the deeply in-debt municipality, but critics say that cuts will ruin the community’s signature diversity.

headline.seo: In Montclair, Elections Cause Town to Re-examine Itself
headline.main: After Spending Freely, Liberal Town Faces Fight on Frugality
headline.print_headline: After Spending Freely, a Liberal Community Fights Over Frugality
